page.title: 19Wildlife in East Leicester.
page.content: Although we live in a city,there is still a lot of wildlife in the parks, open spaces & in our gardens. In a school survey it was found that mice were the most common creatures seen in gardens,followed by hedgehogs,bats & squirrels. Occasionally a rat is spotted & if you live close to open ground,a rabbit or even a fox. The most common birds seen in gardens are starlings & sparrows. There are also blackbirds,thrushes & robins. Bigger birds like pigeon,seagulls,crows, jackdaws & even the occasional magpie will visit city gardens. House martins & swallows are quite common,as are blue tits & great tits. Present,but more difficult to see are the owls & wrens.
